method.name: GET
method.doc:
Returns a URL for an image file displaying historical Zestimates for a property specified by Zillow property ID. The chart can show percentage or dollar value change, and you can constrain the size of the image. The historical data can cover periods of 1, 5, or 10 years.
API documentation: http://www.zillow.com/howto/api/GetChart.htm

param.name: zws-id
param.doc: The Zillow Web Service Identifier. Each subscriber to Zillow Web Services is uniquely identified by an ID sequence and every request to Web services requires this ID. Go here to get yours: http://www.zillow.com/webservice/Registration.htm

param.name: zpid
param.doc: The Zillow Property ID for the property, an integer value that you can obtain by calling the GetSearchResults method.

param.name: unit-type
param.doc: A string value of "percent" or "dollar" that specifies whether to show the change as a percentage or a dollar value.

param.name: width
param.doc: Optional. The width of the generated image, an integer from 200 to 600.

param.name: height
param.doc: Optional. The height of the generated image, an integer from 100 to 300.

param.name: chartduration
param.doc: Optional. The period for which data is shown in the chart. Defaults to 1 year. Values can be "1year", "5years", or "10years".

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of comparable recent sales for a property. The results include the address, the Zillow property ID, and the Zestimate for the comparable properties and the principal property. API documentation : http://www.zillow.com/howto/api/GetComps.htm

param.name: zws-id
param.doc: The Zillow Web Service Identifier. Each subscriber to Zillow Web Services is uniquely identified by an ID sequence and every request to Web services requires this ID. Go here to get yours: http://www.zillow.com/webservice/Registration.htm

param.name: zpid
param.doc: The Zillow Property ID for the property for which to obtain information; the parameter type is an integer

param.name: count
param.doc: The number of comparable recent sales to obtain.

method.name: GET
method.doc:
Returns a list of comparable recent sales for a property. The results include the address, the Zillow property identifier, and the Zestimate for the comparable properties and the principal property, as well as extensive property data for the comparable properties.
API documentation : http://www.zillow.com/howto/api/GetDeepComps.htm

param.name: zws-id
param.doc: The Zillow Web Service Identifier. Each subscriber to Zillow Web Services is uniquely identified by an ID sequence and every request to Web services requires this ID. Go here to get yours: http://www.zillow.com/webservice/Registration.htm

param.name: zpid
param.doc: The Zillow Property ID for the property, an integer value that you can obtain by calling the GetSearchResults method.

param.name: count
param.doc: The number of comparable recent sales to obtain.

method.name: GET
method.doc:
Finds a property given an address. The returned intormation includes the address for the property or properties, the Zillow Property ID (ZPID, the current Zestimate, the date the Zestimate was computed, a valuation range, and the Zestimate ranking for the property within its ZIP code. If no exact address match for a property is found, a match for nearby properties is returned. This deep search also provides detailed property data like lot size, year built, bath/beds, last sale details, and so on.
API documentation : http://www.zillow.com/howto/api/GetDeepSearchResults.htm

param.name: zws-id
param.doc: The Zillow Web Service Identifier. Each subscriber to Zillow Web Services is uniquely identified by an ID sequence and every request to Web services requires this ID. Go here to get yours: http://www.zillow.com/webservice/Registration.htm

param.name: address
param.doc: The address of the property to search. This string should be URL encoded.

param.name: citystatezip
param.doc: The city+state combination and/or ZIP code for which to search. This string should be URL encoded. Note that giving both city and state is required. Using just one will not work.

method.name: GET
method.doc:
Returns a URL for an image file displaying historical Zestimates for a region specified by city, state, and/or zipcode. The chart can show percentage or dollar value change, and you can constrain the size of the image. The historical data can cover periods of 1, 5, or 10 years.
API documentation : http://www.zillow.com/howto/api/GetRegionChart.htm

param.name: zws-id
param.doc: The Zillow Web Service Identifier. Each subscriber to Zillow Web Services is uniquely identified by an ID sequence and every request to Web services requires this ID. Go here to get yours: http://www.zillow.com/webservice/Registration.htm

param.name: unit-type
param.doc: A string value of "percent" or "dollar" that specifies whether to show the change as a percentage or a dollar value.

param.name: city
param.doc: Optional. The name of a city.

param.name: state
param.doc: Optional. The two-letter abbrivation of a state. For a list of abbreviations, see: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_codes

param.name: ZIP
param.doc: Optional. The 5-digit ZIP code.

param.name: width
param.doc: Optional. The width of the generated image, an integer from 200 to 600.

param.name: height
param.doc: Optional. The height of the generated image, an integer from 100 to 300.

param.name: Chartduration
param.doc: Optional. The period for which data is shown in the chart. Defaults to 1 year. Values can be "1year", "5years", or "10years".

method.name: GET
method.doc:
Finds a property given an address. The returned intormation includes the address for the property or properties, the Zillow Property ID (ZPID, the current Zestimate, the date the Zestimate was computed, a valuation range, and the Zestimate ranking for the property within its ZIP code. If no exact address match for a property is found, a match for nearby properties is returned.
API documentation : http://www.zillow.com/howto/api/GetSearchResults.htm

param.name: zws-id
param.doc: The Zillow Web Service Identifier. Each subscriber to Zillow Web Services is uniquely identified by an ID sequence and every request to Web services requires this ID. Go here to get yours: http://www.zillow.com/webservice/Registration.htm

param.name: address
param.doc: The address of the property to search for. This string should be URL encoded.

param.name: citystatezip
param.doc:
The city+state combination and/or ZIP code for which to search. This string should be URL encoded. Note that giving both city and state is required. Using just one will not work.
For more information on URL encoding and a quick way to encode your URLs, see http://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_urlencode.asp.

method.name: GET
method.doc:
For a specified Zillow property identifier (zpid), returns the most recent property Zestimate, the date the Zestimate was computed, the valuation range, the Zestimate ranking within the property's ZIP code, the full property address and geographic location (latitude/longitude), and a set of identifiers that uniquely represent the region (ZIP code, city, county, and state) of the property. If a request is made for a property that has no Zestimate, an error code is returned (502 if a property is found, but there is no Zestimate).
API documentation: http://www.zillow.com/howto/api/GetZestimate.htm

param.name: zws-id
param.doc: The Zillow Web Service Identifier. Each subscriber to Zillow Web Services is uniquely identified by an ID sequence and every request to Web services requires this ID. Go here to get yours: http://www.zillow.com/webservice/Registration.htm

param.name: zpid
param.doc: The Zillow Property ID for the property, an integer value that you can obtain by calling the GetSearchResults method.

method.name: GET
method.doc:
For a specified region, returns a set of demographic data which includes a URL linking to the corresponding demographics pages at Zillow.com, census information organized into affordability, homes and real estate and people categories, who lives here, and what's unique about the people.
A region can be specified either through its respective region ID or by providing state, city or neighborhood. The neighborhood parameter can be omitted if demographic data on a city is desired. The state and city parameter are always required.
API documentation: http://www.zillow.com/howto/api/GetDemographics.htm

param.name: zws-id
param.doc: The Zillow Web Service Identifier. Each subscriber to Zillow Web Services is uniquely identified by an ID sequence and every request to Web services requires this ID. Go here to get yours: http://www.zillow.com/webservice/Registration.htm

param.name: rid
param.doc: The regionId of the region to retrieve data from.

param.name: state
param.doc: The state of the region to retrieve data from.

param.name: city
param.doc: The city of the region to retrieve data from.

param.name: neighborhood
param.doc: The neighborhood of the region to retrieve data from.

method.name: GET
method.doc:
For a specified region, returns a list of subregions which includes subregion type, region IDs, region names, URL to corresponding Zillow page (only for cities and neighborhoods), latitudes and longitudes.
A region can be specified at various levels of the region hierarchy. Allowable region types are country, state, county, and city. Country and county are optional parameters unless they are the region to be specified. An optional childtype parameter can also be specified to return subregions of a specific type.
API documentation: http://www.zillow.com/howto/api/GetRegionChildren.htm

param.name: zws-id
param.doc: The Zillow Web Service Identifier. Each subscriber to Zillow Web Services is uniquely identified by an ID sequence and every request to Web services requires this ID. Go here to get yours: http://www.zillow.com/webservice/Registration.htm

param.name: regionid
param.doc: The regionId of the region to retrieve subregions from.

param.name: country
param.doc: The country of the region to retrieve subregions from.

param.name: state
param.doc: The state of the region to retrieve subregions from.

param.name: county
param.doc: The county of the region to retrieve subregions from.

param.name: city
param.doc: The city of the region to retrieve subregions from.

param.name: childType
param.doc: The type of subregions to retrieve (available types: state, county, city, zipcode, and neighborhood).
